name: Kashi Vishwanath

location.sacred_geography: In the old Kashi area on the western bank of the Ganga

significance.philosophy: Kashi is traditionally described as Shiva's city and a moksha-kshetra in Hindu belief.

stats.daily_visitors: Varies by season and festival calendar
stats.annual_visitors: Official reporting indicates multi-crore footfall in recent years

description: Kashi Vishwanath is one of the most revered Shiva temples in India and one of the twelve Jyotirlingas. The present temple structure was built in 1780 by Maharani Ahilyabai Holkar, while the wider Kashi tradition traces the site's sacred status to great antiquity.
secret_hook: Kashi's sacred geography around Vishwanath, Annapurna, and the Ganga has inspired continuous pilgrimage traditions for centuries.
